author: Staff Reporter
text:
A fire broke out in the second floor of a private school around 11 a.m. While a few of them suffered injuries, others were safely rescued in a National Evacuation Drill organised by the Fire and Rescue Services Department at Bharathi Matriculation Higher Secondary on Thadagam Road here recently.

Prior to the drill, the students were divided into four groups and were trained by a team of 20 Fire and Rescue Services personnel to rescue fellow victims, to attend to the injured and put off the fire.

As part of the drill, a situation arose with a sudden fire outbreak at the electrical panel box in the second floor of the building, when there were more than 1,000 students. Soon after an alarm was raised, students themselves formed evacuation, first aid, fire and communications teams and jumped into action along with the personnel.

District Fire Officer S.R. Chandran, and school principal K. Periyanayagi assessed the situation.

It was part of a nationwide activity.
title: Training conducted
